thread.title: Essex County Tournament: Bloomfield's boys soccer and girls volleyball both advance
thread.title_full: Essex County Tournament: Bloomfield's boys soccer and girls volleyball both advance

title: Essex County Tournament: Bloomfield's boys soccer and girls volleyball both advance
text:
Buy this photo Joe DiFranco/Staff Photographer The Bengals celebrate following the decisive shootout goal by Dominic Oramas, to propel them into the quarterfinals of the Essex County Tournament. 
Boys Soccer 
The Bloomfield boys' soccer team has advanced to the quarterfinals of the Essex County Tournament. 
The No. 7 seed Bengals defeated No. 10 Columbia in a thrilling shootout victory at Foley Field Wednesday evening. 
After a scoreless first half, Samuel Epitime got the Bengals on the board with a fantastic goal. 
Columbia would return the favor on a goal from Joe Dente. 
The Bengals and Cougars were locked at 1-1 at the end of regulation and after two scoreless overtime periods, the game had to be decided by a shootout. 
After the two teams exchanged successful goals, Bloomfield goalie Kyle Barrow made a huge stop to stave off a Cougar kick. 
The stop set the stage for Dominic Oramas to blast the back of the net and clinch the victory for the Bengals. 
Tomorrow, Oct. 24, Bloomfield will take on No. 2 Seton Hall Prep at Kelly Athletic Complex in West Orange for a 2 p.m. start. 
Last week the Bengals fell to the Pirates 3-1 in a regular season game, but gave them all they could handle. 
The winner of Saturday's match will advance to the semifinal to play the winner of a game between No. 6 Newark Academy and No. 3 Montclair. 
The semifinals will be held at Belleville High School on Wednesday Oct. 28. 
On the opposite side of the bracket; No. 1 West Orange will take on No. 9 Nutley; No. 12 West Essex will face No. 4 Livingston. 
The Essex County Tournament final will be held at Livingston High School on Saturday, Oct. 31. 
Girls Volleyball 
The Bloomfield girls' volleyball team defeated No. 14 Arts in the second round of the Essex County Tournament. 
The No. 3 Bengals swept Arts in straight sets, 25-8, 25-11, with Jessica Carr leading the way with two aces, three kills, 18 assists and four digs. 
The Bengals will now face No. 6 West Essex on Tuesday Oct. 27 at Bloomfield High School's main gym for a 4:15 p.m. start. 
Head coach Louis Stevens' club has yet to face West Essex, but his club brings with them a regular season record 20-2. 
On Monday the girls will host a very strong Cedar Grove team in their final regular season game of the year; a match which will likely determine the champion of the Liberty division.
